data.title: The Woman (2011)
data.meta_description: A crazed family man captures a feral women and subjects her to abuse in an attempt to ‘civilise’ her.
data.text:
Labelled a modern classic by some, ‘torture porn’ by others, Lucky McKee’s uncompromising adaptation of Jack Ketchum’s novel triggered heated debate when it first debuted. An unhinged family man captures a feral woman, subjecting her to a torrent of abuse in a disturbed effort to ‘civilise’ her. A brutal yet searingly intelligent critique of patriarchal abuse with far more than exploitation on its mind.

2011 USA

Directed by

Lucky McKee

Produced by

Andrew van den Houten, Robert Tonino

Written by

Jack Ketchum, Lucky McKee

Featuring

Pollyanna McIntosh, Sean Bridgers, Angela Bettis

Running time

101 minutes
